item.title: {DELTA} How to change home?
item.dc:creator: @Ddragonimp Ddragonimp
item.description:
@Ddragonimp wrote:

		// Setting player standard look
		playerLook[0] = 2;
		playerLook[1] = 6;
		playerLook[2] = 7;
		playerLook[3] = 10;
		playerLook[4] = 5;
		playerLook[5] = 0;

		// initial x and y coordinates of the player
		heightLevel = 0;
		// the first call to updateThisPlayerMovement() will craft the proper
		// initialization packet
		toX = 3080;
		toY = 3508;

in your player.java

item.title: {DELTA} How to change home?
item.dc:creator: @Untrimmed Untrimmed
item.description:
@Untrimmed wrote:

[quote=“wildskiller, post:5, topic:391604”]all servers are different…some dont have commands like “home”
so i would search conifg.java/server.java/client.java/mostclicking.java/player.java
i wouldnt mess with the classes
and search for the coordinates that you teleport to when you go home
and change that to the certain location you want it[/quote]
You sir, have no clue what you’re talking about. It’s delta so it is found in client.java. Second, mostclicking.java doesn’t exsist, it’s clickingmost, besides that has nothing to do with commands. Clickingmost has to do with the spell book or action buttons. Now, a simple home teleport would be something like:

if(command.startsWith("home")){ toX =*X cord here*; toY =*Y cord here"; sM("You teleport home"); }
Or you can do it with a trigger teleport. It would be something like this :

if(command.startsWith("home")){ triggerTele(*X cord here*, *Y cord here*, 0); }
The 0 is the height level.

Read full topic

item.title: {DELTA} How to change home?
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

all servers are different…some dont have commands like “home”
so i would search conifg.java/server.java/client.java/mostclicking.java/player.java
i wouldnt mess with the classes
and search for the coordinates that you teleport to when you go home
and change that to the certain location you want it

Read full topic

item.title: {DELTA} How to change home?
item.dc:creator: @pasta186 pasta186
item.description:
@pasta186 wrote:

Because im nice,here is how:

In client.java,search for “home”.
Thats your command(::home)
THere should be coordinates underneath,change them.Next time,search.
